div.p: NARRATOR: Remember, there are two types of problems that people might experience: impairment problems and health problems.
NARRATOR: Problems are rare in the Green Phase, not uncommon in the Yellow Phase, very common in the Orange Phase, and almost always present in the Red Phase.
NARRATOR: As we progress through the phases, we increase the quantity and frequency of our high-risk choices, thus increasing the risk for health and impairment problems.
NARRATOR: Health problems become likely when we make high-risk choices over a period of months or years.
NARRATOR: This can include damage to any organ and includes risk for addiction, which arises from changes to the brain â€“ not always damage to the brain itself, but damaged brain functions.
NARRATOR: Impairment problems can happen any single time we are impaired. The more often we become impaired, the more likely we are to experience impairment problems.

NARRATOR: We can think of an impairment problem like the number six on dice. It might happen the first time or it might happen the 57th time; but sooner or later, if I keep tossing the dice, the six will turn up.
